brief_summary.textblock:
To compare the effect of mini-exchange-room and usual care on physical activity and quality
      of life in peritoneal dialysis (PD) patients through a randomized controlled study. A total
      of 120 incident CAPD patients with age of 18~80 years old will be enrolled, who are
      medically stable and regularly followed up. The one group perform traditional PD procedure
      (G1), and the other group will utilize disposable mini-exchange-room group (G2). Two groups
      will be followed for 6 months. Biochemistry data, types of space for bag exchange, physical
      activity and quality of life will also be collected for all subjects at the 3rd and 6th
      month. During the study period, peritonitis episode, acute comorbidity and hospitalization
      will be recorded. The change of physical activity, quality of life and peritonitis rate will
      be compared between the two groups.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study Comparing the Impact of Mini-exchange-room and Usual Care on Physical Activity and Quality of Life in Peritoneal Dialysis Patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  The study will be conducted in the Division of Nephrology, Beijing University First
             Hospital. A total of 120 incident CAPD patients with age of 18~80 years old will be
             enrolled, who are medically stable and regularly followed up. Informed consent is
             required for each patient.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Those who have (1) intolerance to the study protocols, (2) severe and unstable
             conditions within one month, acute or chronic inflammation disease, (3) high
             probability (assessed by the recruiting physician) of receiving a kidney transplant
             or transferring to HD or drop-out due to socioeconomic causes within 6 months, (4)
             cognitive or psychological dysfunction, communication barrier, and (5) bag exchange
             by unfixed manipulator, are excluded.
